title: Police investigate shooting of 6-year-old girl
content:
Toledo police are looking for a local woman after her 6-year-old daughter was shot in West Toledo.
Za’nilah Canty, the victim, was admitted to ProMedica Toledo Hospital with a gunshot wound to her right thigh, according to a police unusual incident report. A hospital spokesman said she had no information about a person by that name but police said the girl’s injury “did not appear to be severe.”
Police said the victim’s grandmother, Tessa Canty, who did not witness the Monday shooting, told them it occurred in the residence of Mecca Canty, the victim’s mother, in the 2100 block of Alvin Street near West Bancroft Street about 10:40 p.m. It was the grandmother who took the victim to the hospital, according to police.
The girl told police “she was taking out the trash with her mother, when a black vehicle, driven by a black male, pulled up in front of the residence and began shooting,” according to the police report. Police believe the girl’s story does not appear to be credible, according to written statement by police.
“We are currently looking for the mother [Mecca Canty] to get her version of what happened,” police said in the report.
